subject: RE: [junit] Runtime arguments to be submitted to MyTestCase
msgSnippet: Hey, JUnit is not licensed under GPL.  It s IBM Common Public License, which is quite different.
messageBody:
Hey,

JUnit is not licensed under GPL. It's IBM Common Public License, which
is quite different.

http://oss.software.ibm.com/developerworks/oss/license-cpl.html

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: noushi@... [mailto:noushi@...]
> Sent: Saturday, June 08, 2002 12:27 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Runtime arguments to be submitted to MyTestCase
>
[...]
> I won't change it's source, as long as I can work around it!
> And if I can't, I'll tell my client that this part of the
> software (junit changed
> source) has to be released in GPL, and I'll immediately
> submit it to the mailing list. If he's not ok with it, he'll
> have no product! When you're talking about composition, does
> that imply that I'm infringing junit's license agreement when
> I'm inheriting?
[snip]
